children.value:
Content is a container component which provides its' child elements with
consistent vertical spacing and padding.

<Playground>
  <Content>
    <Card title="About me">
      <Content>
        <Content spacing="large">
          <Heading level={2}>Sign up!</Heading>
          <Text>
            Aenean eu leo quam. Pellentesque ornare sem lacinia quam venenatis
            vestibulum. Nulla vitae elit libero, a pharetra augue. Nullam quis
            risus eget urna mollis ornare vel eu leo. Vestibulum id ligula porta
            felis euismod semper. Curabitur blandit tempus porttitor.
          </Text>
        </Content>
        <InputText placeholder="Name" />
        <InputText placeholder="Phone" />
        <InputText placeholder="Email" />
        <InputText
          multiline={true}
          placeholder="Describe yourself"
          name="describeAge"
        />
      </Content>
    </Card>
  </Content>
</Playground>

Content should be used whenever you have a container with mixed content that
requires consistent spacing between the elements.

<Playground>
  <Card title="About me">
    <Content>

      <Text>

      </Text>
    </Content>
